snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s executive order directing authorities to pull homeless people off the streets in freezing weather has angered the very people it claims to protect.
abstract: Homeless people in New York City call Gov Andrew Cuomo's order to remove them from street in below-freezing temperatures misguided, saying forced placement is not solution to problem; call for increase in permanent, affordable housing throughout city.

byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s executive order directing authorities to pull homeless people off the streets in freezing weather has angered the very people it claims to protect.

headline.main: Cuomo Misses Point, Homeless on Streets Say
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Misses Point, People on Streets Say
